a hand-written transcription

note.p: Draft lines of "You Tides with Ceaseless Swell," first published along with seven other poems in The Nineteenth Century (August 1885), under the general title "Fancies at Navesink."

bibl.author: Whitman, Walt
bibl.title: Fancies at Navesink
bibl.orgName: The Thomas Biggs Harned Collection of the Papers of Walt Whitman, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.
bibl.note: Transcribed from digital images of the original.
The verso contains the following words: "? or simply The Tides."

lg.l:
Lofty the glance of the
eye

Some mighty invisible
spirit is j moving
swiftly overhead
